intro: Pelexia congesta, commonly known as the dense pelexia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Pelexia congesta is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
